pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū bhiṃsāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were scaring the monks from the group of seventeen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.8.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six scare other monks?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhuṃ bhiṃsāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk scares a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.8.pli: upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetukāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati. Bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.8.eng: if one who is fully ordained, wishing to scare another who is fully ordained, arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact, then whether the other monk is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.9.pli: Corakantāraṃ vā vāḷakantāraṃ vā pisācakantāraṃ vā ācikkhati. Bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.9.eng: If he tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons, then whether the other monk is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetukāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.4.eng: If, wishing to scare someone who is not fully ordained, he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.5.pli: Bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.5.eng: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.6.pli: Corakantāraṃ vā vāḷakantāraṃ vā pisācakantāraṃ vā ācikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.6.eng: If he tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.7.pli: Bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.7.eng: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.9.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.10.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.2.pli: na bhiṃsāpetukāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati, corakantāraṃ vā vāḷakantāraṃ vā pisācakantāraṃ vā ācikkhati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.2.eng: if he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact, or he tells about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, predatory animals, or demons, but not because he wishes to scare anyone;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on scaring, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū hemantike kāle aññataraṃ mahantaṃ susirakaṭṭhaṃ jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.2.eng: At that time, during winter, the monks were warming themselves after setting fire to a hollow log.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.3.pli: Tasmiñca susire kaṇhasappo agginā santatto nikkhamitvā bhikkhū paripātesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.3.eng: Heated by the fire, a black snake came out of the log and attacked the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.4.eng: The monks ran here and there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.6.eng: “How could those monks light a fire to warm themselves?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.10.eng: “How could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.12.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādaheyya vā samādahāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.14.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.14.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.1.eng: At one time a number of monks were sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.2.eng: The monks who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.4.eng: “Previously we lit a fire to warm ourselves,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.6.pli: Idāni pana ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na visibbema, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.6.eng: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t warm ourselves because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. Because of that we’re not comfortable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.7.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.8.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā jotiṃ samādahitvā vā samādahāpetvā vā visibbetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.8.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to light a fire to warm himself, or to have one lit.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.9.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.10.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu agilāno visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādaheyya vā samādahāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.10.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is not sick lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.11.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.11.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū padīpepi jotikepi jantāgharepi kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks did not light lamps, small fires, or saunas because they were afraid of wrongdoing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.1.comm: Sp 2.352: Jotikepīti pattapacanasedakammādīsu jotikaraṇe, “Jotikepi: making a fire to fire a bowl, to make sweat, etc.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.3.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tathārūpappaccayā jotiṃ samādahituṃ samādahāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.3.eng: “Monks, I allow you to light a fire, or to have one lit, if there’s a suitable reason.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.4.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.4.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.5.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu agilāno visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādaheyya vā samādahāpeyya vā, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.5.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is not sick lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.6.eng: who is comfortable without a fire.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.8.pli: yassa vinā agginā na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.8.eng: who is not comfortable without a fire.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.14.eng: if he lights it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.16.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.17.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi samādahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.17.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other lights many fires, he commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.18.eng: Except if there is a suitable reason:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.19.eng: unless there is a suitable reason.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.1.pli: Agilāno agilānasaññī visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādahati vā samādahāpeti vā, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.1.eng: If he is not sick, and he does not perceive himself as sick, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.2.pli: Agilāno vematiko visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādahati vā samādahāpeti vā, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.2.eng: If he is not sick, but he is unsure of it, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.3.pli: Agilāno gilānasaññī visibbanāpekkho jotiṃ samādahati vā samādahāpeti vā, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.3.eng: If he is not sick, but he perceives himself as sick, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.4.eng: If he puts back a burning piece of wood that has fallen off, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.4.comm: Sp 2.355: Paṭilātaṁ ukkhipatīti dayhamānaṁ alātaṁ patitaṁ ukkhipati, puna yathāṭhāne ṭhapetīti attho, “Paṭilātaṁ ukkhipati: he picks up a burning firebrand that has fallen. The meaning is that he puts it back in its original place.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.5.eng: If he is sick, but he does not perceive himself as sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.6.eng: If he is sick, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.7.eng: If he is sick, and he perceives himself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.3.eng: if he warms himself over a fire lit by another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.4.eng: if he warms himself over flameless coals;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.5.eng: if he lights a lamp, a small fire, or a sauna, when there is a suitable reason;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.9.eng: The training rule on fire, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū tapode nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.2.eng: the monks were bathing in the hot springs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro “sīsaṃ nahāyissāmī”ti tapodaṃ gantvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.3.eng: Just then King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha went to the hot springs, intending to wash his hair.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.4.pli: “yāvāyyā nahāyantī”ti ekamantaṃ paṭimānesi. Bhikkhū yāva samandhakārā nahāyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.4.eng: He waited respectfully for the monks to finish, but they kept on bathing until dark.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.5.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro vikāle sīsaṃ nahāyitvā, nagaradvāre thakite bahinagare vasitvā, kālasseva asambhinnena vilepanena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.5.eng: Only then was King Bimbisāra able to wash his hair. And because the town gates had been shut, he had to spend the night outside the city.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.5.comm: Asambhinnena vilepanena is an unusual expression. Sp-ṭ 2.357: Asambhinnenāti amakkhitena, anaṭṭhenāti attho, “Asambhinnena: the meaning is ‘with (make-up) not smeared, not lost’.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.6.eng: In the morning, with his make-up still on, he went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.7.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ bhagavā etadavoca—“kissa tvaṃ, mahārāja, kālasseva āgato asambhinnena vilepanenā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.7.eng: The Buddha said to him, “Great king, why have you come so early in the morning, with your make-up still on?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.8.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.8.eng: The king told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi. Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.9.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which the king got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū rājānampi passitvā na mattaṃ jānitvā nahāyantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks bathed without moderation, even after seeing the king?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā rājānampi passitvā na mattaṃ jānitvā nahāyissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.14.eng: “How could those foolish men act in this way?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.16.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.18.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.18.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū uṇhasamaye pariḷāhasamaye kukkuccāyantā na nahāyanti, sedagatena gattena sayanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, because they were afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not bathe when it was hot or when they had a fever, and they went to sleep covered in sweat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.2.eng: As a consequence, their robes and beds got dirty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.3.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.4.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, uṇhasamaye pariḷāhasamaye orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.4.eng: “Monks, if it’s hot or you have a fever, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānanti vassānassa paṭhamo māso iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo pariḷāhasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.7.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards some monks were sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.2.eng: The monks who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.4.pli: “Pubbe mayaṃ, āvuso, orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyāma, tena no phāsu hoti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.4.eng: “Previously we bathed at intervals of less than a half-month, and then we were comfortable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.5.pli: idāni pana ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na nahāyāma, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.5.eng: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t bathe because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. Because of that we’re not comfortable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.7.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.7.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.8.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.9.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.9.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.10.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānanti vassānassa paṭhamo māso iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.10.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.11.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.11.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū navakammaṃ katvā kukkuccāyantā na nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks were doing building work, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.2.pli: Te sedagatena gattena sayanti. Cīvarampi senāsanampi dussati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.2.eng: As a consequence, they went to sleep covered in sweat, and their robes and beds got dirty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you’re working.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānanti vassānassa paṭhamo māso iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.7.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū addhānaṃ gantvā kukkuccāyantā na nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks were traveling, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.2.pli: Te sedagatena gattena sayanti. Cīvarampi senāsanampi dussati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.2.eng: As a consequence, they went to sleep covered in sweat, and their robes and beds got dirty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you’re traveling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānanti vassānassa paṭhamo māso iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.7.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū ajjhokāse cīvarakammaṃ karontā sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti. Devo ca thokaṃ thokaṃ phusāyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks were making robes out in the open, when they were hit by dusty winds and fine rain.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.2.pli: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na nahāyanti, kilinnena gattena sayanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.2.eng: But because they were afraid of wrongdoing, they did not bathe afterwards, and they went to sleep while still wet.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.3.eng: As a consequence, their robes and beds got dirty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.5.eng: “Monks, if there is wind and rain, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.6.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.6.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.7.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu orenaddhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.7.1.eng: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.8.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānanti vassānassa paṭhamo māso iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.8.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling; there is wind and rain.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.5.eng: At intervals of less than a half-month:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.8.pli: cuṇṇena vā mattikāya vā nahāyati, payoge payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.8.eng: if he bathes with bath powder or soap, then for every effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.8.comm: For an explanation of the renderings “bath powder” and “soap” for cuṇṇa and mattika respectively, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.9.eng: When the bath is finished, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.11.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.15.pli: vassānassa paṭhamo māso “iccete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo pariḷāhasamayo”ti nahāyitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.15.eng: the first month of the rainy season. During the two-and-a-half-month period of summer and the fever season, he may bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.17.pli: yassa vinā nahānena na phāsu hoti. Gilānasamayoti nahāyitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.17.eng: he is not comfortable without bathing. If he is sick, he may bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.19.eng: even if he just sweeps the yard of a building. If he is working, he may bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.21.pli: “addhayojanaṃ gacchissāmī”ti nahāyitabbaṃ, gacchantena nahāyitabbaṃ, gatena nahāyitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.21.eng: if he intends to travel six kilometers, he may bathe; while traveling, he may bathe; after he has traveled, he may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.21.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.23.pli: bhikkhū sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti, dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni kāye patitāni honti. “Vātavuṭṭhisamayo”ti nahāyitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.23.eng: monks are hit by dusty winds, and two or three drops of rain fall on their bodies. If there is wind and rain, they may bathe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.1.pli: Ūnakaddhamāse ūnakasaññī, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.1.eng: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, and he perceives it as less, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.2.pli: Ūnakaddhamāse vematiko, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.2.eng: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, but he is unsure of it, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.3.pli: Ūnakaddhamāse atirekasaññī, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.3.eng: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, but he perceives it as more, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.4.eng: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.5.eng: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.6.eng: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, and he perceives it as more, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.3.eng: if he bathes at intervals of a half-month;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.4.eng: if he bathes at intervals of more than a half-month;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.5.eng: if he bathes while crossing a body of water;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.6.eng: if he is outside the central Ganges plain;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.10.eng: The training rule on bathing, the seventh is finished.
